text: <@U6LUSCS1J> Tsabo Tavoc is better than she looks.
The worst thing about her is the CMC, but you get Coffers/Urborg, Nykthos and lots of rocks to help.

<@U3QMCLQQG> Tsabo is amazing. What sucks is he specifically requested Tsabo to be built as Mercenary tribal. There's only 38 total B/R mercs. There are changelings, but most of them suck outside of Cairn Wanderer and Taurean Mauler.
I was thinking of doing Mercenary, Assassins, and Rogues only in Tsabo and just rocking snipers for the most part.
I *love* sniper decks. You could also always run Henry's favorite card [[Conspiracy]]

attachments.fallback: Conspiracy {3}{B}{B} // Enchantment // As Conspiracy enters the battlefield, choose a creature type. // Creatures you control are the chosen type. The same is true for creature spells you control and creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
As Conspiracy enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures you control are the chosen type. The same is true for creature spells you control and creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield.

text: At that point you’re running a mono-Black deck with a red splash.
even with merc tribal we're pretty much doing the same thing
there's like 3 red mercs and they all suck
at least with assassins and rogues we get [[fortune thief]] and [[grenzo, havoc raiser]] etc.

Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, choose one —
• Goad target creature that player controls.

*2/2*

text: He's pretty good. I've got him in the rough draft so far.
Odd how so many are ocercostwd tutors for more mercenaries.
That's my main issue with the tribe. They're all just overcost tutors. Thinning your deck out is great, but in EDH we have 99 card decks and the differeence of 2 vs. 99 is marginal most of the time.
Yeah, you’re going to have to go the Conspiracy route and leverage the more cheaply costed tutors.
Yeah, I also think I'm going to have to run a bunch of Rakdos punisher enchantments to grind their totals down low.
Stuff like [[rain of gore]] and [[pain magnification]]

text: Run Tainted Remedy over Rain of Gore.
Rain of Gore has some annoying loopholes.
Yeah, I'm worried about that being non-bo with Erebos. I could just as easily run Everlasting Torment and such right?

text: Woof.
Those costs.
It's a cool card, but damn.
We have to ramp hard to tsabo anyways
True.
Our commander is 7 as well. Might as well run splashy stuff like Vicious Shadows and Grave Betrayal
Don't fill up on too many 7 CMC cards. You'll end up with stuff you want to cast instead of Tsabo
Our deck is absurd as well. All the more reason to run absurd stuff.
Very true. I just want to run a couple that definitely matter.
I always try to run fewer cards with the same exact CMC as my commander.
It's a good rule of thumb.
It's skews my curve a bit, but it makes sure I always want to/can play my commander
But yeah, for Tsabo, it's probably fine.
I keep wanting to build/make Kaervek work.
It's worth the trade off. Do you think this is a good time for [[Wound Reflection]]?

text: Another expensive Rakdos commander.
Kaervek is fantastic.
Wound reflection is nasty.
WR with Temporal Extortion.

Henry, that's awesome
Yeah I'm running like 8 mana rocks on top of Burnished Hart and Solemn.
Temporal Extortion doesn't see enough play.
It just means you get the extra turn or someone dies.
If you get the extra turn someone should be dying anyway.
Yeah.
Here's what I have so far. I'm definitely open to suggestions. This is a bit of a head scratcher for me.

text: Archfiend has amazing synergy with scorpion god though.
And cycling is fantastic for shooting through a deck.
We may have taken the deck too far from Tsabo Mercenaries at this point, though.
As I feared. Mercenaries is just such a bad tribe.
I think Mercenaries are just linear and boring.
They will always always always play out the same way or get disrupted.
That was the reader request though. I think they're just fucking with me but challenge accepted.
The best way to make them interesting is to not play them
The issue I'm running into is that for the CMC there is just more relevant stuff.
Sure that too.
